definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: The nurses denied the charges and said they had been tortured into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 而护士们否认这些控告并说她们是被屈打成招。

sentences.english: The nurses denied the charges and said they were tortured into confessing.
sentences.chinese: 而护士们否认这些控告并说她们是被屈打成招。

sentences.english: Many of the doctors and nurses say they were tortured into making confessions.
sentences.chinese: 许多医生和护士声称他们被屈打成招。

sentences.english: Zawahiri has alleged that his former comrade was tortured into recanting.
sentences.chinese: 扎瓦希里宣称他的前战友是被屈打成招的。

definition: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to frame/to bring false charges against
to commit suicide to escape punishment
